sentence.text: Conclusions: The expression of negative regulation of osteoblast differentiation in human glioma is positively correlated with the malignant grade of glioma, which may be involved in the malignant progression of glioma by EMT

Real-time fluorescence quantitative PCR and Western blot were used to detect the expression level of negative regulation of osteoblast differentiation mRNA and protein in 61 cases of fresh glioma tissue (WHO grade Ⅱ 16 cases, Ⅲ 21 cases, Ⅳ 24 cases) and 12 cases of adjacent tissues, and the expression levels of E-cadherin, N-cadherin and vimentin were also investigated in fresh glioma tissue.

Methods: Using immunohistochemical method detected the expression level of negative regulation of osteoblast differentiation in 60 cases of gliomas (including WHO grades Ⅱ, Ⅲ and Ⅳ, each for 20 cases) and 20 cases of non-tumor brain tissues.
The percentages of negative regulation of osteoblast differentiation expression were 75% (15/20), 95% (19/20), and 100% (20/20) in the WHO gradesⅡ, Ⅲ and Ⅳ gliomas, respectively.

Detection of key protein expression in EMT by Western blot displayed that the expression of E-cadherin was negatively associated with negative regulation of osteoblast differentiation in glioma (r=-0.972, P<0.01).
